intro: Dalechampia affinis, commonly known as the silky dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with latex-producing properties. Its growth habit is typically herbaceous, with a sprawling or upright form depending on environmental conditions. Dalechampia affinis is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges.
